001/*

004 * See LICENSE for details.

006
007package renderer.models_F;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012/**
013   Create a wireframe model of a cube with its center
014   at the origin, having edge length 2, and with its
015   corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}.
016<p>
017   This version of the cube model has each face of
018   the cube cut up by a triangle fan.
019<p>
020   Here is a picture showing how the cube's eight
021   corners are labeled.
022<pre>{@code
023                  v4=(-1,1,-1)
024                  +---------------------+ v5=(1,1,-1)
025                 /|                    /|
026                / |                   / |
027               /  |                  /  |
028              /   |                 /   |
029             /    |                /    |
030         v7 +---------------------+ v6  |
031            |     |               |     |
032            |     |               |     |
033            |     | v0=(-1,-1,-1) |     |
034            |     +---------------|-----+ v1=(1,-1,-1)
035            |    /                |    /
036            |   /                 |   /
037            |  /                  |  /
038            | /                   | /
039            |/                    |/
040            +---------------------+
041            v3=(-1,-1,1)          v2=(1,-1,1)
042}</pre>
043
044   @see Cube
045   @see Cube2
046   @see Cube4
047*/
048public class Cube3 extends Model
049{
050   /**
051      Create a cube with its center at the origin, having edge
052      length 2, with its corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}. and
053      with a triangle fan of four triangles in each face.
054   */
055   public Cube3( )
056   {
057      this(1, 1, 1);
058   }
059
060
061   /**
062      Create a cube with its center at the origin, having edge
063      length 2, with its corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}, and
064      with each of the cube's faces containing a triangle fan
065      with the given number of triangles along each of the x,
066      y, and z directions.
067      <p>
068      There must be at least one triangle along each direction.
069
070      @param xCount  number of triangles along the x-direction
071      @param yCount  number of triangles along the y-direction
072      @param zCount  number of triangles along the z-direction
073      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code xCount} is less than 1
074      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code yCount} is less than 1
075      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code zCount} is less than 1
076   */
077   public Cube3(int xCount, int yCount, int zCount)
078   {
079      super( String.format("Cube3(%d,%d,%d)", xCount, yCount, zCount) );
080
081      if (xCount < 1)
082         throw new IllegalArgumentException("xCount must be greater than or equal to 1");
083      if (yCount < 1)
084         throw new IllegalArgumentException("yCount must be greater than or equal to 1");
085      if (zCount < 1)
086         throw new IllegalArgumentException("zCount must be greater than or equal to 1");
087
088      final double xStep = 2.0 / xCount,
089                   yStep = 2.0 / yCount,
090                   zStep = 2.0 / zCount;
091
092      addVertex(new Vertex(0,  0,  1),  // center front
093                new Vertex(0,  0, -1),  // center back
094                new Vertex(0,  1,  0),  // top center
095                new Vertex(0, -1,  0),  // center bottom
096                new Vertex( 1, 0,  0),  // center right
097                new Vertex(-1, 0,  0)); // center left
098
099      int index = 0;
100      int cFront  = index;
101      int cBack   = index + 1;
102      int cTop    = index + 2;
103      int cBottom = index + 3;
104      int rCenter = index + 4;
105      int lCenter = index + 5;
106      index += 6;
107
108      // Triangles along all four edges parallel to the x-axis.
109      double x = -1.0;
110      addVertex(new Vertex(x,  1,  1),   // index - 4
111                new Vertex(x, -1,  1),   // index - 3
112                new Vertex(x,  1, -1),   // index - 2
113                new Vertex(x, -1, -1));  // index - 1
114      index += 4;
115      for (int i = 0; i < xCount; ++i)
116      {
117         x += xStep;
118         addVertex(new Vertex(x,  1,  1),   // index + 0
119                   new Vertex(x, -1,  1),   // index + 1
120                   new Vertex(x,  1, -1),   // index + 2
121                   new Vertex(x, -1, -1));  // index + 3
122         // front face, top and bottom edges
123         addPrimitive(new Face(index-4, cFront, index+0),
124                      new Face(index-3, index+1, cFront));
125         // back face, top and bottom edges
126         addPrimitive(new Face(index-2, index+2, cBack),
127                      new Face(index-1, cBack, index+3));
128         // top face, front and back edges
129         addPrimitive(new Face(index-4, index+0, cTop),
130                      new Face(index-2, cTop, index+2));
131         // bottom face, front and back edges
132         addPrimitive(new Face(index-3, cBottom, index+1),
133                      new Face(index-1, index+3, cBottom));
134         index += 4;
135      }
136
137      // Triangles along all four edges parallel to the y-axis.
138      double y = -1.0;
139      addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  y,  1),   // index - 4
140                new Vertex(-1,  y,  1),   // index - 3
141                new Vertex( 1,  y, -1),   // index - 2
142                new Vertex(-1,  y, -1));  // index - 1
143      index += 4;
144      for (int i = 0; i < yCount; ++i)
145      {
146         y += yStep;
147         addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  y,  1),   // index + 0
148                   new Vertex(-1,  y,  1),   // index + 1
149                   new Vertex( 1,  y, -1),   // index + 2
150                   new Vertex(-1,  y, -1));  // index + 3
151         // front face, right and left edges
152         addPrimitive(new Face(index-4, index+0, cFront),
153                      new Face(index-3, cFront,  index+1));
154         // back face, right and left edges
155         addPrimitive(new Face(index-2, cBack,   index+2),
156                      new Face(index-1, index+3, cBack));
157         // right face, front and back edges
158         addPrimitive(new Face(index-4, rCenter, index+0),
159                      new Face(index-2, index+2, rCenter));
160         // left face, front and back edges
161         addPrimitive(new Face(index-3, index+1, lCenter),
162                      new Face(index-1, lCenter, index+3));
163         index += 4;
164      }
165
166      // Triangles along all four edges parallel to the z-axis.
167      double z = -1.0;
168      addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  1,  z),   // index - 4
169                new Vertex(-1,  1,  z),   // index - 3
170                new Vertex( 1, -1,  z),   // index - 2
171                new Vertex(-1, -1,  z));  // index - 1
172      index += 4;
173      for (int i = 0; i < zCount; ++i)
174      {
175         z += zStep;
176         addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  1,  z),   // index + 0
177                   new Vertex(-1,  1,  z),   // index + 1
178                   new Vertex( 1, -1,  z),   // index + 2
179                   new Vertex(-1, -1,  z));  // index + 3
180         // top face, right and left edges
181         addPrimitive(new Face(index-4, cTop, index+0),
182                      new Face(index-3, index+1, cTop));
183         // bottom face, right and left edges
184         addPrimitive(new Face(index-2, index+2, cBottom),
185                      new Face(index-1, cBottom, index+3));
186         // right face, top and bottom edges
187         addPrimitive(new Face(index-4, index+0, rCenter),
188                      new Face(index-2, rCenter, index+2));
189         // left face, top and bottom edges
190         addPrimitive(new Face(index-3, lCenter, index+1),
191                      new Face(index-1, index+3, lCenter));
192         index += 4;
193      }
194   }
195}//Cube3
